sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_strategy"><sn_aia_strategy action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><name>ReAct</name><sys_class_name>sn_aia_strategy</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2024-07-15 10:09:48</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_name>ReAct</sys_name><sys_package display_value="Now Assist AI Agents" source="sn_aia">32808450431302106c3603295bb8f245</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="Now Assist AI Agents">32808450431302106c3603295bb8f245</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_strategy_f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2024-07-15 10:10:15</sys_updated_on><topic display_value="AIA-ReAct">6e4f08cd1b1b4210f4200d81ec4bcb87</topic></sn_aia_strategy></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_14ad72a1838032107f448287ceda1e05
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Helps DevOps engineers restart EC2 instances from incident tickets by reading incident descriptions and executing remediation scripts with human approval</description><instructions>IMPORTANT! If the instance or incident number prefix given do not begin with i-... or EC2_INC..., please display message: "Please double-check your incident/instance number and try again" and terminate the flow.
You will be provided with an instance number or an incident number. The instance number prefix starts with i- The incident number only prefix with EC2_INC-…
Step 1: First always ask me if I want to manually fix the issue related to the provide incident or instance or should you proceed with the automatic resolution (since manual fix is also available)?
If I say Yes or Manually Fix or something similar, please display message "Follow the steps outlined in the Slack message for a manual fix".
If I say No or Automatic Fix or something similar, please proceed with Step 2.
Step 2: If you get an instance number, use the tool called EC2 Remediate by Instance ID. If you get an incident number, use the tool called Look Up the Instance ID from the EC2 Incident Table.</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_ec2_monito_0.EC2 Remediation Assistant</internal_name><name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</name><proficiency>- The agent is proficient in identifying and resolving performance issues within EC2 instances, focusing on restarting or turning on failed instances to ensure system stability and continuity. - The agent is capable of validating instance and incident numbers, ensuring they begin with the correct prefixes (i- or EC2_INC-), and can terminate the flow with a message if the prefixes are incorrect, thereby preventing errors in task execution. - The agent can engage in a decision-making process to determine whether to proceed with a manual or automatic resolution of issues, displaying appropriate messages based on user input to guide the resolution process. - The agent can utilize the 'Look Up the Instance ID from the EC2 Incident Table' tool to efficiently retrieve the Instance ID based on the provided incident number, facilitating the subsequent remediation steps. - The agent is equipped with the 'EC2 Remediate by Instance ID' tool, enabling it to turn on EC2 instances by using the Instance ID, thereby directly addressing and resolving performance issues.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You are an expert in assisting DevOps team in troubleshooting and remediating performance issues in the system. Your role is to restart (or turn on) the failed EC2 instances.</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-17 22:41:03</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>14ad72a1838032107f448287ceda1e05</sys_id><sys_mod_count>48</sys_mod_count><sys_name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">6eda282d83b322107f448287ceda1e47</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">6eda282d83b322107f448287ceda1e47</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_14ad72a1838032107f448287ceda1e05</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-18 14:56:29</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>AIA ReAct Engine</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-09-18 11:28:15">8244667983c032107f448287ceda1ee5</execution_plan><metadata>{}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"result":"{\"Thought\":\"The mission is to help with incident EC2_INC0001026. The user has opted for automatic resolution. According to the predefined directives, since I have an incident number, I need to use the tool 'Look Up the Instance ID from the EC2 Incident Table' to retrieve the Instance ID associated with the incident number EC2_INC0001026.\",\"Action\":{\"Action Reason\":\"The user has chosen automatic resolution, and I have an incident number. Therefore, I need to use the 'Look Up the Instance ID from the EC2 Incident Table' tool to retrieve the Instance ID associated with the incident number EC2_INC0001026.\",\"Name\":\"Look Up the Instance ID from the EC2 Incident Table\"},\"Action Inputs\":{\"incident_number\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"The incident number EC2_INC0001026 is provided in the mission and is required to look up the Instance ID.\",\"Value\":\"EC2_INC0001026\"},\"crudInputs\":{\"Action Input Reason\":\"The CRUD Input Variables are predefined and necessary for the operation to look up the Instance ID from the EC2 Monitoring Incidents table.\",\"Value\":{\"operation\":\"lookup\",\"table\":{\"value\":\"x_snc_ec2_monito_0_ec2_monitoring_incidents\",\"displayValue\":\"EC2 Monitoring Incidents\"},\"query\":\"number=\",\"returnFields\":[{\"id\":\"instance_id\",\"sublabel\":\"instance_id\",\"label\":\"Instance ID\",\"type\":\"reference\",\"referenceTable\":\"x_snc_ec2_monito_0_ec2_instance\",\"referenceTableDefaultField\":\"sys_id\",\"referenceKey\":null,\"excludedOperators\":[]}],\"limit\":\"1\",\"orderBy\":\"\",\"sortType\":\"\"}}},\"URL\":\"/sys_gen_ai_log_metadata.do?sys_id=a064aaf983c032107f448287ceda1ee9\",\"Time\":\"5656\"}"}</output><parent display_value="Created 2025-09-18 11:28:16">92446af983c032107f448287ceda1e8f</parent><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-18 15:28:36</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>47546af983c032107f448287ceda1eb0</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-18 15:28:42</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>undefined</target_document_id><target_document_table>undefined</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>gen_ai</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>EC2 Remediation Assistant</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-09-18 11:28:15">8244667983c032107f448287ceda1ee5</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"EC2 Remediation Assistant","role":"You are an expert in assisting DevOps team in troubleshooting and remediating performance issues in the system. Your role is to restart (or turn on) the failed EC2 instances.","background":"IMPORTANT! If the instance or incident number prefix given do not begin with i-... or EC2_INC..., please display message: "Please double-check your incident/instance number and try again" and terminate the flow. 

You will be provided with an instance number or an incident number. 
The instance number prefix starts with i-
The incident number only prefix with EC2_INC-…

Step 1:
First always ask me if I want to manually fix the issue related to the provide incident or instance or should you proceed with the automatic resolution (since manual fix is also available)?

If I say Yes or Manually Fix or something similar, please display message "Follow the steps outlined in the Slack message for a manual fix".

If I say No or Automatic Fix or something similar, please proceed with Step 2.

Step 2:
If you get an instance number, use the tool called EC2 Remediate by Instance ID. If you get an incident number, use the tool called Look Up the Instance ID from the EC2 Incident Table.","sys_id":"14ad72a1838032107f448287ceda1e05","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Help me with incident EC2_INC0001026
","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"result":"The incident EC2_INC0001026 has been resolved successfully by restarting the associated instance."}</output><parent/><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-18 15:28:16</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>92446af983c032107f448287ceda1e8f</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-18 15:29:18</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>14ad72a1838032107f448287ceda1e05</target_document_id><target_document_table>sn_aia_agent</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>agent</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_tool_b86de7ad830832107f448287ceda1ea6
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_tool"><sn_aia_tool action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><description>Retrieve Instance ID based on the provided Incident Number.</description><input_schema>[{"name":"incident_number","description":"incident number"},{"name":"crudInputs","description":"CRUD Input Variables. These are already pre-defined. Under no circumstances should you prompt the user for this information or attempt to change these values."}]</input_schema><name>Look Up the Instance ID from the EC2 Incident Table</name><record_type>custom</record_type><script><![CDATA[(function(inputs) {
    // only string inputs are allowed 
    // return outputs object where the keys in it are understandable by LLM    
    // lookup script

    // parses expression containing {{variables}}
    function parseQuery(expression, inputs) {
        if (!expression) return "";
        return expression.replace(/{{\s*(\w+)\s*}}/g, function(match, variableName) {
            if (inputs && inputs.hasOwnProperty(variableName)) {
                return inputs[variableName];
            }
            return "";
        });

    }

    function getTypedValue(gr, table, field) {
        var fieldValue = gr.getValue(field.id);
        if (field.type === "choice") {
            var choiceGR = new GlideRecordSecure("sys_choice");
            choiceGR.addQuery("name", table);
            choiceGR.addQuery("element", field.id);
            choiceGR.addQuery("value", fieldValue);
            choiceGR.query();
            if (choiceGR.next()) {
                return choiceGR.getValue('label');
            }
        } else if (field.referenceTable) {
            var refName = field.referenceTableDefaultField;
            var refGR = new GlideRecordSecure(field.referenceTable);
            refGR.addQuery("sys_id", fieldValue);
            refGR.query();
            if (refName && refGR.next()) {
                return refGR.getValue(refName);
            }
        }
        return fieldValue;
    }

    var table = inputs.crudInputs.table.value;
    var tableName = inputs.crudInputs.table.displayValue;
    var query = parseQuery(inputs.crudInputs.query, inputs);
    var sortType = inputs.crudInputs.sortType;
    var orderBy = inputs.crudInputs.orderBy;
    var limit = inputs.crudInputs.limit || 5;
    var fields = inputs.crudInputs.returnFields || [];

    var results = [];
    var protectedRecords = 0;
    var gr = new GlideRecordSecure(table);
    if (query) {
        gr.addEncodedQuery(query);
    }
    if (orderBy && sortType === 'a_to_z') {
        gr.orderBy(orderBy);
    } else if (orderBy && sortType !== 'a_to_z') {
        gr.orderByDesc(orderBy);
    }

    gr.setLimit(limit);
    gr.query();
    while (gr.next()) {
        var fieldObj = {};
        if (gr.canRead()) {
            fields.forEach(function(field) {
                if (gr.canRead(field.id)) {
                    fieldObj[field.id] = getTypedValue(gr, table, field);
                } else {
                    // number of fields that cannot be read for each record
                    if (fieldObj["protectedFields"] >= 1) {
                        fieldObj["protectedFields"]++;
                    } else {
                        fieldObj["protectedFields"] = 1;
                    }
                }
            });
        } else {
            protectedRecords++;
        }
        results.push(fieldObj);
    }
    var recordCount = results.length;
    var total = recordCount + protectedRecords;
    var message = gs.getMessage("{0} out of {1} records returned from the {2} table.",
        [recordCount.toString(), total.toString(), tableName]);

    return {
        "records": results,
        "message": message,
        "status": "success"
    };
})(inputs);]]></script><sys_class_name>sn_aia_tool</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-18 02:09:12</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>b86de7ad830832107f448287ceda1ea6</sys_id><sys_mod_count>1</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Look Up the Instance ID from the EC2 Incident Table</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">6eda282d83b322107f448287ceda1e47</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">6eda282d83b322107f448287ceda1e47</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_tool_b86de7ad830832107f448287ceda1ea6</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-18 14:28:47</sys_updated_on><target_document/><target_document_table>undefined</target_document_table><type>crud</type></sn_aia_tool></record_update>
sys_update_xml.target_name: Look Up the Instance ID from the EC2 Incident Table

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_tool_52934bed838032107f448287ceda1ec1
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_tool"><sn_aia_tool action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><description>Use my EC2 Tool to turn the instance ID ON</description><input_schema>[{"name":"instance_id","description":"string that starts with i- and then has many characters"}]</input_schema><name>EC2 Remediate by Instance ID</name><record_type>custom</record_type><script><![CDATA[(function(inputs) {
    try {
        var instanceId = inputs.instance_id;
        if (!instanceId || !instanceId.match(/^i-[0-9a-f]{8,17}$/)) {
            return {
                'success': 'false',
                'message': 'Invalid instance ID format. Expected: i-xxxxxxxxx',
                'instance_id': instanceId || 'not_provided'
            };
        }

        var ec2Gr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_ec2_instance');
        ec2Gr.addQuery('instance_id', instanceId);
        ec2Gr.query();
        
        if (!ec2Gr.next()) {
            return {
                'success': 'false',
                'message': 'EC2 instance not found in monitoring system: ' + instanceId,
                'instance_id': instanceId
            };
        }

        var ec2SysId = ec2Gr.getUniqueValue();
        gs.info('EC2 Agent: Found instance record, sys_id=' + ec2SysId);

        // Get credentials from connection store
        var aliasGr = new GlideRecord('sys_alias');
        aliasGr.addQuery('name', 'AWS Integration Server C C Alias');
        aliasGr.query();
        if (!aliasGr.next()) {
            return {
                'success': 'false',
                'message': 'Connection alias not found: AWS Integration Server C C Alias',
                'instance_id': instanceId
            };
        }
        
        var aliasSysId = aliasGr.getUniqueValue();
        var connectionInfo = new sn_cc.ConnectionInfoProvider().getConnectionInfoByDomain(aliasSysId, 'global');
        var username = connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute("user_name");
        var password = connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute("password");
        var connectionUrl = connectionInfo.getAttribute("connection_url");

        // Make API call to restart instance
        var request = new sn_ws.RESTMessageV2();
        request.setEndpoint(connectionUrl);
        request.setHttpMethod('POST');
        request.setBasicAuth(username, password);
        request.setRequestHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');
        request.setRequestHeader('Accept', 'application/json');
        
        var requestBody = JSON.stringify({
            instance_id: instanceId
        });
        request.setRequestBody(requestBody);

        var startTime = new Date().getTime();
        var response = request.execute();
        var endTime = new Date().getTime();
        var responseTime = endTime - startTime;

        var httpStatusCode = response.getStatusCode();
        var responseBody = response.getBody();
        var errorMessage = response.getErrorMessage();
        var isSuccess = (httpStatusCode >= 200 && httpStatusCode < 300);

        gs.info('EC2 Agent: API Response - Status: ' + httpStatusCode + ', Body: ' + responseBody);

        var logGr = new GlideRecord('x_snc_ec2_monito_0_remediation_log');
        logGr.initialize();
        logGr.setValue('ec2_instance', ec2SysId);
        logGr.setValue('attempted_status', 'On');
        logGr.setValue('timestamp', new GlideDateTime());
        logGr.setValue('request_payload', requestBody);
        logGr.setValue('success', isSuccess);
        logGr.setValue('response_payload', responseBody);
        logGr.setValue('http_status_code', httpStatusCode);
        logGr.setValue('response_time_ms', responseTime);
        
        if (!isSuccess) {
            var fullErrorMessage = 'API call failed - HTTP ' + httpStatusCode;
            if (errorMessage) {
                fullErrorMessage += '\nError: ' + errorMessage;
            }
            if (responseBody) {
                fullErrorMessage += '\nResponse: ' + responseBody;
            }
            logGr.setValue('error_message', fullErrorMessage);
        }

        var logId = logGr.insert();
        gs.info('EC2 Agent: Created log entry: ' + logId);

        return {
            'success': isSuccess.toString(),
            'message': isSuccess ? 
                'Instance restart request sent successfully! Response time: ' + responseTime + 'ms' : 
                'Restart failed - HTTP ' + httpStatusCode + ': ' + (errorMessage || responseBody),
            'instance_id': instanceId,
            'log_id': logId,
            'http_status': httpStatusCode.toString(),
            'response_time_ms': responseTime.toString()
        };

    } catch (e) {
        var errorMsg = 'Exception in EC2 remediation: ' + e.message;
        gs.error('EC2 Agent error: ' + errorMsg);
        
        return {
            'success': 'false',
            'message': errorMsg,
            'instance_id': inputs.instance_id || 'unknown'
        };
    }
})(inputs);]]></script><sys_class_name>sn_aia_tool</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-17 23:06:37</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>52934bed838032107f448287ceda1ec1</sys_id><sys_mod_count>15</sys_mod_count><sys_name>EC2 Remediate by Instance ID</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">6eda282d83b322107f448287ceda1e47</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">6eda282d83b322107f448287ceda1e47</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_tool_52934bed838032107f448287ceda1ec1</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-18 14:28:47</sys_updated_on><target_document/><target_document_table/><type>script</type></sn_aia_tool></record_update>
